member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.AtomicInteger
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.AtomicInteger(Type)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the value by copying the binary representation of the provided value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.AtomicInteger(AtomicInteger)
member.summary: Copy constructor. Initializes the object by copying the raw value from another atomic object, ensuring atomic consistency.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator Type() const
member.summary: Implicitly converts the AtomicInteger object to a value of type Type. Internally calls fetch() to return a thread-safe snapshot of the current value.
member.returns: Returns copy of the current value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeRawValue
member.summary: Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal raw value. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
member.returns: Returns a reference to the internal raw value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeRawValue const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeRawValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns a const reference to the internal raw value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getRawValuePtr
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the internal raw value.
member.returns: Returns a pointer to the internal raw value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getRawValuePtr const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getRawValuePtr(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns a const pointer to the internal raw value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeValue
member.summary: Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal logical value, reinterpreted from the raw data. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.
member.returns: Returns non-thread-safe reference to the stored value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeValue const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns non-thread-safe const reference to the stored value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getValuePtr
member.summary: Returns a raw pointer to the internal value, reinterpreted from the raw data. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.
member.returns: Returns pointer to the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getValuePtr const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getValuePtr(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns const pointer to the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetch const
member.summary: Retrieves the current value in a lock-free, thread-safe manner. Performs an atomic read of the raw internal storage and reinterprets the result.
member.returns: Returns copy of the stored value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.store(Type)
member.summary: Stores a new value by writing its raw binary representation atomically into internal storage. Ensures thread-safe write access without locks.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator=(Type)
member.summary: Copy assignment operator. Stores the new value atomically by calling store().
member.returns: Returns the assigned value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator=(AtomicInteger)
member.summary: Copy assignment operator. Atomically replaces the internal value with the one from another atomic object.
member.returns: Returns the copied value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.swap(Type)
member.summary: Atomically replaces the current value with a new one and returns the old value.
member.returns: Returns the value that was stored before swap.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.compareAndSwap(Type,Type)
member.summary: Performs a lock-free compare-and-swap operation. If the current value equals old_value, it is replaced with new_value.
member.param: New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
member.returns: Returns true if the internal value was updated; false if the current value did not match old_value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.spinLock(Type,Type)
member.summary: Continuously attempts to atomically swap the value from old_value to new_value using compareAndSwap().
member.param: New value to assign if the current matches the expected.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.waitValue(Type)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread in a spin loop until the internal value becomes equal to the provided one. Internally calls spinLock(v, v) and rechecks after each failure.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchAdd(Type)
member.summary: Atomically adds value to the current atomic value and returns the previous value.
member.returns: Returns the value held before the addition.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchSub(Type)
member.summary: Atomically subtracts value from the current atomic value and returns the previous value.
member.returns: Returns the value held before the subtraction.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchAnd(Type)
member.summary: Atomically performs a bitwise AND with value and returns the previous value.
member.returns: Returns the value before the operation.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchOr(Type)
member.summary: Atomically performs a bitwise OR with value and returns the previous value.
member.returns: Returns the value before the operation.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchXor(Type)
member.summary: Atomically performs a bitwise XOR with value and returns the previous value.
member.returns: Returns the value before the operation.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchInc
member.summary: Atomically increments the current value by 1.
member.returns: The value held before the increment.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchDec
member.summary: Atomically decrements the current value by 1.
member.returns: The value held before the decrement.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator+=(Type)
member.summary: Atomically adds value to the current value and returns the result after the addition.
member.returns: The updated value after the addition.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator-=(Type)
member.summary: Atomically subtracts value from the current value and returns the result after the subtraction.
member.returns: The updated value after the subtraction.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator++(int)
member.summary: Postfix increment. Atomically increments the current value by 1.
member.param: dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
member.returns: The value before the increment.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator--(int)
member.summary: Postfix decrement. Atomically decrements the current value by 1.
member.param: dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
member.returns: The value before the decrement.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator++
member.summary: Prefix increment. Atomically increments the current value by 1.
member.returns: The value after the increment.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator--
member.summary: Prefix decrement. Atomically decrements the current value by 1.
member.returns: The value after the decrement.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator&=(Type)
member.summary: Atomically performs a bitwise AND with value and updates the current value.
member.returns: The updated value after the operation.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator|=(Type)
member.summary: Atomically performs a bitwise OR with value and updates the current value.
member.returns: The updated value after the operation.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator^=(Type)
member.summary: Atomically performs a bitwise XOR with value and updates the current value.
member.returns: The updated value after the operation.

member.name: F:Unigine.AtomicInteger.isLockFree
member.summary: Indicates that the implementation is lock-free and performs atomic operations without using mutexes.

member.summary: Implicitly converts the AtomicLockFreeAlign object to a value of type Type. Internally calls fetch() to return a thread-safe snapshot of the current value.

member.summary: Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal raw value. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
member.returns: Returns a reference to the internal raw value.

member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeRawValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns a const reference to the internal raw value.

member.summary: Returns a pointer to the internal raw value.
member.returns: Returns a pointer to the internal raw value.

member.summary: Const-qualified version of getRawValuePtr(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns a const pointer to the internal raw value.

member.summary: Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal logical value, reinterpreted from the raw data. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.
member.returns: Returns non-thread-safe reference to the stored value.

member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns non-thread-safe const reference to the stored value.

member.summary: Returns a raw pointer to the internal value, reinterpreted from the raw data. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.
member.returns: Returns pointer to the internal value.

member.summary: Const-qualified version of getValuePtr(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns const pointer to the internal value.

member.summary: Retrieves the current value in a lock-free, thread-safe manner. Performs an atomic read of the raw internal storage and reinterprets the result.

member.summary: Stores a new value by writing its raw binary representation atomically into internal storage.

member.summary: Copy assignment operator. Stores the new value atomically by calling store().
member.returns: Returns the assigned value.

member.summary: Copy assignment operator. Atomically replaces the internal value with the one from another atomic object.
member.returns: Returns the copied value.

member.summary: Atomically replaces the current value with a new one and returns the old value.
member.returns: Returns the value that was stored before swap.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.AtomicPointer
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.AtomicPointer(Type)
member.summary: Construcor. Constructs an atomic pointer initialized with the given raw pointer value.
member.param: The pointer value to initialize with (e.g., int*, MyStruct*).

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.AtomicPointer(AtomicPointer)
member.summary: Copy constructor. Atomically copies the pointer value from another AtomicPointer<Type> instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator Type() const
member.summary: Implicitly converts the AtomicPointer object to a value of type Type. Internally calls fetch() to return a thread-safe snapshot of the current value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getUnsafeRawValue
member.summary: Returns a non-atomic reference to the internal raw 64-bit representation of the pointer. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
member.returns: Reference to the internal value storing the pointer.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getUnsafeRawValue const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeRawValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Reference to the internal value storing the pointer.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getRawValuePtr
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the raw storage of the atomic pointer. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
member.returns: Pointer to the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getRawValuePtr const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getRawValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Const pointer to the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getUnsafeValue
member.summary: Returns a non-atomic reference to the stored pointer as a typed value. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
member.returns: Reference to the pointer value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getUnsafeValue const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Const reference to the pointer value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getValuePtr
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the stored pointer value, cast to its original type.
member.returns: A typed pointer to the internal data.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.getValuePtr const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getValuePtr(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: A typed const pointer to the internal data.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetch const
member.summary: Atomically retrieves the current pointer value.
member.returns: The current pointer value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.store(Type)
member.summary: Atomically stores a new pointer value.
member.param: The new pointer value to store atomically.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator=(Type)
member.summary: Atomically assigns a new raw pointer value.
member.param: The new pointer value to assign.
member.returns: Returns the assigned pointer value (same as v).

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator=(AtomicPointer)
member.summary: Atomically copies the pointer value from another AtomicPointer<Type> instance.
member.param: Another atomic pointer of the same type to copy from.
member.returns: The newly assigned pointer value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.swap(Type)
member.summary: Atomically replaces the current pointer value with the provided value and returns the previous value.
member.param: The pointer value to assign atomically.
member.returns: The pointer value that was held before the swap.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.compareAndSwap(Type,Type)
member.summary: Performs a lock-free compare-and-swap operation. If the current value equals old_value, it is replaced with new_value.
member.param: New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
member.returns: Returns true if the internal value was updated; false if the current value did not match old_value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.spinLock(Type,Type)
member.summary: Continuously attempts to atomically swap the value from old_value to new_value using compareAndSwap().
member.param: New value to assign if the current matches the expected.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.waitValue(Type)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread in a spin loop until the internal value becomes equal to the provided one. Internally calls spinLock(v, v) and rechecks after each failure.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchAdd(long)
member.summary: Atomically moves the pointer forward by a given number of positions.
member.param: The number of elements to add; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is advanced by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
member.returns: Returns the value held before the addition.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchSub(long)
member.summary: Atomically moves the pointer backward by a given number of positions.
member.param: The number of elements to subtract; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is moved backward by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
member.returns: Returns the value held before the subtraction.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchInc
member.summary: Atomically increments the pointer by one position.
member.returns: Returns the value held before the increment.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchDec
member.summary: Atomically decrements the pointer by one position.
member.returns: Returns the value held before the decrement.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator+=(long)
member.summary: Atomically moves the pointer by a given number of positions.
member.param: The number of elements to add; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is advanced by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
member.returns: Returns the value held after the addition.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator-=(long)
member.summary: Atomically moves the pointer backward by a given number of positions.
member.param: The number of elements to subtract; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is moved backward by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
member.returns: Returns the value held after the subtraction.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator++(int)
member.summary: Atomically decrements the pointer by one position (postfix form).
member.param: dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
member.returns: Postfix increment. Returns the value held before the decrement.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator--(int)
member.summary: Atomically increments the pointer by one position (postfix form).
member.param: dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
member.returns: Postfix decrement. Returns the value held before the increment.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator++
member.summary: Prefix increment. Atomically increments the pointer by one position.
member.returns: Returns the value held after the increment.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator--
member.summary: Prefix decrement. Atomically decrements the pointer by one position.
member.returns: Returns the value held after the decrement.

member.name: F:Unigine.AtomicPointer.isLockFree
member.summary: Indicates that the implementation is lock-free and performs atomic operations without using mutexes.

member.name: F:Unigine.AtomicPointer.SIZE_TYPE
member.summary: Represents the size (in bytes) of the object pointed to by the pointer type <Type>

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.AtomicWithMutex
member.summary: Default constructor. Initializes the internal value with its default constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.AtomicWithMutex(Type)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the internal value with the provided input.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.AtomicWithMutex(AtomicWithMutex)
member.summary: Copy constructor. Locks both source and destination mutexes to safely copy the provided value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.operator Type()
member.summary: Implicitly converts the AtomicWithMutex object to a value of type Type. Internally calls fetch() to return a thread-safe snapshot of the current value.
member.returns: Returns copy of the current value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getUnsafeValue
member.summary: Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal value. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
member.returns: Returns non-thread-safe reference to the stored value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getUnsafeValue const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getUnsafeValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
member.returns: Returns non-thread-safe const reference to the stored value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getValuePtr
member.summary: Returns a raw pointer to the internal value without locking. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.
member.returns: Returns pointer to the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getValuePtr const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getValuePtr().
member.returns: Returns const pointer to the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getMutex
member.summary: Provides direct access to the internal mutex object. This allows external code to manually lock or unlock the mutex.
member.returns: Returns the reference to the mutex used for protecting the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getMutex const
member.summary: Const-qualified version of getMutex().
member.returns: Returns the const reference to the mutex used for protecting the internal value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.fetch const
member.summary: Retrieves the current value in a thread-safe manner. Acquires the mutex, copies the internal value, then releases the mutex. Preferred over direct access when consistent reads are required.
member.returns: Returns copy of the stored value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.store(Type)
member.summary: Sets the internal value to a new value in a thread-safe way. The entire assignment is protected by the mutex to avoid race conditions with readers or other writers.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.operator=(Type)
member.summary: Thread-safe assignment operator that stores a new value internally. Equivalent to calling store().
member.returns: Returns a const reference to the assigned value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.operator=(AtomicWithMutex)
member.summary: Thread-safe copy assignment from another AtomicWithMutex. Locks both the source and destination mutexes to prevent data races.
member.returns: Returns the copied value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.swap(Type)
member.summary: Atomically replaces the current value with a new one and returns the old value.
member.returns: Returns the value that was stored before swap.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.compareAndSwap(Type,Type)
member.summary: Performs a compare-and-swap operation. If the current value equals old_value, it is replaced with new_value.
member.param: New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
member.returns: true if the internal value was updated; false if the current value did not math old_value.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.spinLock(Type,Type)
member.summary: Continuously attempts to atomically swap the value from old_value to new_value using compareAndSwap().
member.param: New value to assign if the current matches the expected.

member.name: M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.waitValue(Type)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread in a spin loop until the internal value becomes equal to the provided one. Internally calls spinLock(v, v) and rechecks after each failure.

member.name: F:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.isLockFree
member.summary: Indicates that this implementation is not lock-free, unlike standard atomic types such as std::atomic.

member.name: M:Unigine.BackoffSpinner.BackoffSpinner
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new Backoff Spinner.

member.name: M:Unigine.BackoffSpinner.spin
member.summary: Implements adaptive backoff by progressively increasing wait intervals. Begins with exponentially growing CPU pause instructions based on an internal counter; after reaching a threshold, yields to allow other threads to execute. Increments the backoff counter on each invocation.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.#ctor
member.summary: Default CPUShader class constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.runSync(int)
member.summary: Runs CPU shader code synchronously. This method is blocking. No additional threads are created, as the Engine's thread pool is used.
member.param: Number of threads to be used. The default value of -1 sets an optimum number of threads calculated for the particular PC.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.runAsync(int)
member.summary: Runs CPU shader code asynchronously. This method is non-blocking. No additional threads are created, as the Engine's thread pool is used.
member.param: Number of threads to be used. The default value of -1 sets an optimum number of threads calculated for the particular PC.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.wait
member.summary: Waits for running asynchronous shader code execution.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.isRunning
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the CPU shader code is currently executed.
member.returns: 1 if the shader code is currently executed; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.getNumThreads
member.summary: Returns the currently used number of threads.
member.returns: Number of currently used threads.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShader.process(int,int)
member.summary: Override this method to implement calculations.
member.param: Current thread number. This number is not a thread ID, it just a virtual number.
Number of threads to be used.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShaderCallable.CPUShaderCallable(Process,Destroy)
member.summary: Creates a new shader task with execution and destruction logic.
member.param: Function executed once after all threads are done.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShaderCallable.process(int,int)
member.summary: Overridden from CPUShader. Called once per thread during execution. Invokes the provided processing function.
member.param: Total number of threads assigned to this task.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShaderCallableStateless.#ctor(Process)
member.summary: Creates a new shader task with execution logic.

member.name: M:Unigine.CPUShaderCallableStateless.process(int,int)
member.summary: Overridden from CPUShader. Called once per thread during execution. Invokes the provided processing function.
member.param: Total number of threads assigned to this task.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.isInitialized
member.summary: Returns whether the pool has been initialized.
member.returns: Returns 1 if pool is initialized; 0 otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.isRunning
member.summary: Returns whether any shader is currently active.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one shader is running; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.getNumActiveShaders
member.summary: Returns the number of currently active shaders.
member.returns: Number of currently running shader tasks.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.getNumActiveProcesses
member.summary: Returns the number of active shader processes.
member.returns: Number of currently queued or running processes.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.getCurrentThreadIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the current thread within the shader pool.
member.returns: Index of the current thread in the pool, if called from a worker thread.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.getNumThreads
member.summary: Returns the number of worker threads available in the pool.
member.returns: Total number of threads in the shader pool.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.wait
member.summary: Blocks until all currently active shader tasks have completed.

member.name: M:Unigine.PoolCPUShaders.signal
member.summary: Signals the worker threads to resume execution (used internally).

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.MutexAdvance
member.summary: Default constructor. Initializes the internal mutex and sets the lock state to unlocked.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.lock
member.summary: Acquires the internal mutex and marks the lock state as active.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.unlock
member.summary: Releases the internal mutex and marks the lock state as inactive.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.tryLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the lock without blocking. First checks the internal flag for a fast-path rejection, then tries to acquire the underlying mutex.
member.returns: Returns true if the lock was successfully acquired, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.isLocked
member.summary: Returns the current lock status of the mutex by checking the internal flag.
member.returns: Returns true if the lock is currently held, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.waitForce
member.summary: Forces the current thread to wait by acquiring and immediately releasing the lock.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.wait
member.summary: Waits for the mutex to be released if it is currently locked. Returns immediately if the lock is not held.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.MutexCriticalSection
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the internal CRITICAL_SECTION object.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.~MutexCriticalSection
member.summary: Destructor. Destroys the internal CRITICAL_SECTION object.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.lock
member.summary: Acquires the critical section, blocking the calling thread if necessary until the lock becomes available.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.tryLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the critical section without blocking.
member.returns: Returns true if the lock was succesfully acquired; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.unlock
member.summary: Releases the critical section, allowing other threads to enter.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.MutexSlim
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the internal SRWLOCK by calling WinAPI::InitializeSRWLock.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.~MutexSlim
member.summary: Destructor. Asserts that the lock is not held during destruction.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.lock
member.summary: Acquires the slim lock in exclusive (write) mode. Blocks the calling thread if the lock is already held.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.tryLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the slim lock in exclusive mode without blocking.
member.returns: Returns true if the mutex was successfully locked, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.unlock
member.summary: Releases the exclusive slim lock.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexSpin.MutexSpin
member.summary: Default constructor. Initializes the internal lock state to unlocked.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexSpin.lock
member.summary: Acquires the spinlock by continuously checking the internal lock variable until it becomes available. Once the lock is acquired, sets the lock state.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexSpin.tryLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the spinlock without blocking.
member.returns: Returns true if the lock was successfully acquired; false if the lock is already held by another thread.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexSpin.unlock
member.summary: Releases the spinlock by setting the internal lock variable to the unlocked state.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexSpin.isLocked const
member.summary: Checks whether the spinlock is currently held by any thread.
member.returns: Returns true if the spinlock is currently locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.MutexSpin.wait
member.summary: Spins until the lock becomes free without attempting to acquire it.

member.name: M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.MutexPThread
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the internal pthread_mutex_t with default attributes.

member.name: M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.~MutexPThread
member.summary: Destructor. Destroys the internal mutex. Must not be called while the mutex is locked.

member.name: M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.lock
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the mutex becomes available and then locks it.

member.name: M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.tryLock
member.summary: Attempts to lock the mutex without blocking.
member.returns: Returns true if the mutex was successfully locked, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.unlock
member.summary: Releases the mutex, allowing other threads to acquire it.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.ReentrantMutexBase
member.summary: Default constructor. Initializes the internal state, setting the lock as available.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.lock
member.summary: Acquires the mutex. If the current thread already owns the lock, increments the reentrancy depth instead of re-locking the underlying mutex.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.tryLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire the mutex without blocking. If the current thread already owns the lock, increments the reentrancy depth.
member.returns: Returns true if if the mutex was successfully acquired; false if the mutex is currently held by another thread.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.unlock
member.summary: Releases the mutex. If the lock has been acquired multiple times by the same thread, decrements the reentrancy depth. Once the depth reaches zero, releases the underlying mutex and clears thread ownership.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.isLocked
member.summary: Checks whether the mutex is currently considered locked by any thread.
member.returns: Ruturns true if the mutex is locked; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.waitForce
member.summary: Forces the current thread to wait until the mutex becomes available by acquiring and then immediately releasing the lock.

member.name: M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.wait
member.summary: Waits for the mutex to be released by another thread. If the mutex is currently unowned or already owned by the calling thread, the method returns immediately. Otherwise, it blocks by calling waitForce().

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.RWMutexSlim
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the internal SRWLOCK by calling WinAPI::InitializeSRWLock.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.~RWMutexSlim
member.summary: Destructor. Asserts that the lock is not held during destruction.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.lockRead
member.summary: Acquires a shared (read) lock. Multiple threads can hold the read lock concurrently.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.tryLockRead
member.summary: Attempts to acquire a shared (read) lock without blocking.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.unlockRead
member.summary: Releases a shared (read) lock previously acquired.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.lockWrite
member.summary: Acquires an exclusive (write) lock. Blocks until no other thread holds a read or write lock.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.tryLockWrite
member.summary: Attempts to acquire an exclusive (write) lock without blocking.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.unlockWrite
member.summary: Releases an exclusive (write) lock previously acquired.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.lock
member.summary: Alias for lockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSlim to be used in generic locking interfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.tryLock
member.summary: Alias for tryLockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSlim to be used in generic locking interfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.unlock
member.summary: Alias for unlockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSlim to be used in generic locking interfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.RWMutexSpin
member.summary: Default constructor. Initializes the internal lock state with no active readers or writers.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.lockRead
member.summary: Acquires a shared (read) lock. Multiple threads can acquire read access concurrently as long as no writer holds the lock.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.tryLockRead
member.summary: Attempts to acquire a read lock without blocking. Fails if a writer currently holds the lock.
member.returns: Returns true if the read lock was successfully acquired; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.unlockRead
member.summary: Releases a previously acquired read lock by decrementing the reader count.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.lockWrite
member.summary: Acquires an exclusive (write) lock. Blocks until no other thread holds a read or write lock.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.tryLockWrite
member.summary: Attempts to acquire a write lock without blocking. Succeeds only if no readers or writers currently hold the lock.
member.returns: Returns true if the write lock was successfully acquired; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.unlockWrite
member.summary: Releases a previously acquired write lock by resetting the writer flag.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.lock
member.summary: Alias for lockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSpin to be used in generic locking interfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.tryLock
member.summary: Alias for tryLockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSpin to be used in generic locking interfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.unlock
member.summary: Alias for unlockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSpin to be used in generic locking interfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedMutexLock.ScopedMutexLock(MutexType)
member.summary: Constructor that locks the provided mutex. The lock remains held for the duration of the ScopedMutexLock object's lifetime.
member.param: A reference to a mutex object to be locked. The mutex must provide lock() and unlock() member functions.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedMutexLock.~ScopedMutexLock
member.summary: Destructor that automatically unlocks the mutex when the ScopedMutexLock object goes out of scope.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedMutexReaderLock.ScopedMutexReaderLock(MutexType)
member.summary: Constructor that locks the provided mutex for reading. The lock remains held for the duration of the ScopedMutexReaderLock object's lifetime.
member.param: A reference to a mutex object to be locked for reading. The mutex must provide lockRead() and unlockRead() member functions.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedMutexReaderLock.~ScopedMutexReaderLock
member.summary: Destructor that automatically unlocks the mutex when the ScopedMutexReaderLock object goes out of scope.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedMutexWriterLock.ScopedMutexWriterLock(MutexType)
member.summary: Constructor that locks the provided mutex for writing. The lock remains held for the duration of the ScopedMutexWriterLock object's lifetime.
member.param: A reference to a mutex object to be locked for writing. The mutex must provide lockWrite() and unlockWrite() member functions.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedMutexWriterLock.~ScopedMutexWriterLock
member.summary: Destructor that automatically unlocks the mutex when the ScopedMutexWriterLock object goes out of scope.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedSpinLockInteger.ScopedSpinLockInteger(volatileType)
member.summary: Constructor that acquires the spinlock for the provided mutex object. Calls the MutexSpinLock function to acquire the lock. The lock will remain active until the ScopedSpinLockInteger object goes out of scope.
member.param: A reference to the object of type volatile Type that represents the lockable variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.ScopedSpinLockInteger.~ScopedSpinLockInteger
member.summary: Destructor that releases the spinlock by calling the MutexSpinUnlock function.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.getID
member.summary: Returns the current thread identifier.
member.returns: The unique thread identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.setPriority(int)
member.summary: Sets the thread priority.
member.param: Thread priority to set in range [-3;3]. The default thread priority is 0.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the operation was a success; otherwise, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.getPriority const
member.summary: Gets the thread priority.
member.returns: Returns the thread priority in range [-3;3].

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.isRunning const
member.summary: Checks if the thread is running.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the thread is running; otherwise, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.isWaiting const
member.summary: Checks if the thread is waiting.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the thread is waiting; otherwise, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.process
member.summary: Thread process function.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.run(size_t)
member.summary: Runs the thread.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the thread was successfully run; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.signal
member.summary: Signals the thread.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the operation was a success; otherwise, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.stop
member.summary: Stops the thread.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the operation was a success; otherwise, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.terminate
member.summary: Terminates the thread.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the operation was a success; otherwise, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.sleep(unsignedint)
member.summary: Suspends thread execution in milliseconds.

member.name: M:Unigine.Thread.wait
member.summary: Puts the thread into the waiting state.
